subject: Re: Faulty brake pedal
description_text:
Thanks for the advice.  I just tool delivery of the pedals a couple of days
ago and they have not been reconfigured.  They are the condition that they
arrived from the factory.

I tried several times to reset the offset.  The problem still remains, ie.
full depression of the brake pedal produces only a small signal and once
recalibrated the signal is very erratic.  This makes it unusable because
the brake pressure does not correlate to the strength of the signal
received and it's impossible to achieve 100% braking.

I've attached a video showing what happens.

Please advise on next steps

ke 26.11.2025 klo 13.35 support@simsonn.com (support@simsonn.com) kirjoitti:

> Hi Steve Spencer,
>
> If this is the case, it means the pedal’s mechanical structure has been
> adjusted.
> Please click *Offset* in the software to reset the pedal signal to zero;
> the white signal will then start from 0%.
> After recalibrating the pedal, the blue signal will correctly range from
> 0% to 100%.
>
>

conversations.body_text: Hi Steve Spencer,  Please check if there is a bracket in front of your brake pedal blocking the movement of the brake sensor. You can take a photo and send it to me for confirmation.

Hi!

Here are some photos of the brake assembly:

>
> Please check if there is a bracket in front of your brake pedal blocking
> the movement of the brake sensor. You can take a photo and send it to me

Hi Steve Spencer,    It appears that the silver aluminum bracket is blocking the movement of the brake pressure sensor, preventing it from outputting data. Please adjust the installation position of the brake accordingly.
